#Text=Antonio Bicchi
#Text=Antonio
#Text=Bicchi
#Text=is an Italian scientist interested in robotics and intelligent machines .
#Text=He is professor at the University of Pisa and Senior Researcher at Istituto Italiano di Tecnologia in Genoa .
#Text=He is an Adjunct Professor at the School of Biological and Health Systems Engineering of Arizona State University in Tempe , Arizona , USA .
#Text=He is a Fellow of IEEE since 2005 , [ 1 ] and received the IEEE Saridis Leadership Award [ 2 ] and the “ Ordine del Cherubino ” from University of Pisa in 2019 . [ 3 ]
#Text=Early life

#Text=After obtaining a Laurea ( magna cum laude ) from the University of Pisa in 1984 and a Ph.D. from University of Bologna in 1988 , Bicchi was with the Artificial Intelligence Lab of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in Cambridge , MA , USA . [ 4 ]
#Text=From 1990s to 2012 he directed the Research Center “ E. Piaggio ” at the University of Pisa where he was also chairman of the Robotics in the Department of Information Engineering . [ 5 ]
#Text=During his direction , the Center grew in size and in scientific prestige , leading it to count more of 100 researchers and manage over 60 fundamental and applied research projects .

#Text=In 2009 he was appointed as Senior Scientist by the Istituto Italiano di Tecnologia in Genoa , where he created and leads the research line on Soft Robotics for Human Cooperation and Rehabilitation . [ 3 ] [ 6 ]

#Text=Since 2013 he serves as an Adjunct Professor of the School of Biological and Health Systems Engineering , Arizona State University in Tempe , Arizona , where he collaborates with Marco Santello and other colleagues in NSF and DARPA rehabilitation-oriented projects . [ 3 ]
#Text=Research

#Text=Antonio Bicchi has contributed to the fields of Automatic Control ( the science and engineering of systems ) , to Haptics ( the science and technology for the sense of touch ) , and to Robotics , especially focusing on Articulated Soft Robotics .

#Text=He has coordinated several important research projects funded by the EU in the FP7 and H2020 programmes , including CHAT ( on the scalability , reconfigurability and security of distributed control for heterogeneous cyberphysical systems ) , PHRIENDS ( on dependability and safety of physical human-robot interaction ) , [ 7 ] THE Hand Embodied ( on natural and artificial hands ) , and SoftPro ( on the theory and open-source technologies for upper limb prosthetics and rehabilitation ) .

#Text=He was scientific co-coordinator of several others , including TOUCH-HAPSYS ( on haptics science and interfaces ) , [ 8 ] WALK-MAN [ 9 ] ( on humanoid robots for disaster intervention ) , and SOMA ( on soft manipulation systems ) . [ 10 ]
#Text=His 2012-17 ERC AG project SoftHands used neuroscience and soft robotics technologies to develop a new generation of artificial hands . [ 11 ]

#Text=Two subsequent ERC PoC projects ( SoftHands Pro-H and SoftHandler ) explored the translation of these concepts in real-world products for prosthetics and industrial applications , respectively . [ 12 ] [ 13 ]

#Text=The ERC Synergy 2019 project “ Natural BionicS ” will produce the first completely integrated bionic limb system with direct spinal interfacing , through the cooperation of three groups at Imperial College ( led by D. Farina ) , University Hospital Wien ( O. Aszmann ) and IIT ( A. Bicchi ) . [ 14 ]
#Text=Organizer and Educator

#Text=Antonio Bicchi was president of the Italian Society of Automatic Control , twice vice-president of the IEEE Robotics and Automation Society , [ 15 ] and collaborates with major centers for technology transfer in the Italian and European industry .

#Text=He is a consultant for the European Commission , the Italian Ministry of Education and Research ( MIUR ) and agencies in many countries in Europe , America and Asia for the scientific evaluation and accreditation of research centers and universities , research projects , and researchers ' careers .
#Text=In 2005 he founded the WorldHaptics Conference , since then the largest biennial research meeting in the sciences of touch . [ 3 ]
#Text=In 2011 he started the series of conferences
#Text=Automatica which is the main Italian event in the field of Automatic Controls . [ 3 ]

#Text=In 2015 he founded and was subsequently editor-in-chief of the IEEE Robotics and Automation Letters magazine , which in just two years has become the largest scientific journal in the entire field . [ 16 ]
